videos.title: Inside Belgian Waffle Ride 2025 | New Course, Fast Action, We're Back!
videos.description:
Belgian Waffle Ride is always an epic event. BWR has a new location this year which starts in Del Mar and featured a smaller but tight group of favorites from previous winners like Peter Stetina, Alexey Vermeulen and defending champ Matt Beers. This represents a new era in gravel cycling as riders are getting faster on and off the dirt and single track. Notable women include defending champ Sofia Gomez Villafane and Flavia Oliveira. It was an extremely fast race course that had the bicycle pushed to its limit. We always love covering our local bike race BWR. Did you do the event? How was your experience? Let us know in the comments!  


Editor: Michelle Liu
Photo: Kris Hull
Additional Footage: Avery Stumm
Thank you: Ed Philbrick, Michael Marckx

videos.title: Belgian Waffle Ride 2025
videos.description:
BWR was held in a new location this year at the Del Mar Fairgrounds. About half the route was new, while the other half, for those that did the Wafer and the Waffle, was pretty much the same as last year once we got up to Lake Hodge. But, overall it was, as always, a great event worthy of being called one the best North American Gravel Race. 

Oh, also, congrats to both Matt Beers and Sofia Gomez Villafane for their absolute monster of a win 2 years in a row!! WOW!!

videos.title: BWR Wafer and Wanna: Belgian Waffle Ride California 2022
videos.description:
This is the 2022 BWR Wafer and the BWR Wanna in San Marcos, CA, from the perspective of average cyclists. Come experience the more attainable versions of the Belgian Waffle Ride from me while doing the BWR Wafer and from my dad while doing the the BWR Wanna. 

This is the perfect race for us to do together as it meets in the middle of our cycling interests and desire to cover miles. I generally prefer all terrain bicycle touring, and my dad generally prefers cross country mountain biking. 

Other than that, all you really need to know about the BWR is that instead of medals, finishers receive a celebratory bottle of beer. Oh, and who could forget the pre-race waffles and the post-race waffles with ice cream.

We're not sponsored, but we both really liked our bicycle setups, which were as follows:

Me: 
- Sonder Camino gravel bike (https://us.alpkit.com/collections/sonder-camino?storeRedirect=US) with the low end Shimano GRX group set (https://bike.shimano.com/en-EU/product/component/grx-10-speed.html)
-  Teravail Washburn 700 x 38 gravel-specific tires (https://teravail.com/products/washburn-tire?variant=39350969499699)
- Road Runner Bags Jammer Handlebar Bag (https://roadrunnerbags.us/products/the-jammer-bag)

My dad:
- Specialized Diverge Comp gravel bike (https://www.specialized.com/us/en/diverge-comp-e5/p/199975?color=322132-199975)
- Specialized Pathfinder Pro 700 x 38 gravel-specific tires (https://www.specialized.com/us/en/pathfinder-pro-2bliss-ready/p/157870?color=237517-157870&searchText=00019-4412&gclid=Cj0KCQjw-JyUBhCuARIsANUqQ_LyEl2VbNqdxwA5W_cBCQW2IIaaFJPUiSkaK055wDXOtzW3_Opw1AgaAr5PEALw_wcB)
- Road Runner Bags California Burrito Handlebar Bag (https://roadrunnerbags.us/products/california-burrito-handlebar-bag)

This video was filmed on a GoPro Hero 10 (https://gopro.com/en/us/shop/cameras/hero10-black/CHDHX-101-master.html?gclid=Cj0KCQjw-JyUBhCuARIsANUqQ_LMvl54Yh0oDH98xJAuVxjrNKZdQ2vAM8Wgi-6KjeXXuxoCRK7Wk1waAsXvEALw_wcB&gclsrc=aw.ds&option-id=CHDHX-101-master) and my dad's cell phone (I think a Moto G8 or something)

All music and sound effects are from Epidemic Sound, which has an amazing selection. If you use the following link, you can get two months free, and if you subscribe, I'll get a free month as well https://share.epidemicsound.com/x1h7b1

And don't forget to Subscribe, Like, and Comment! Your support makes a huge difference.

videos.title: Belgian Waffle Ride Arizona: race testing a Pivot Vault + touring Pivot's Arizona R&D facility
videos.description:
The inaugural Belgian Waffle Ride Arizona was a rowdy affair, and I took the opportunity to test a Pivot Vault with its IsoFlex frame on the course just up the road from Pivot's Tempe facility.

Before racing the Vault in the 78-mile Wafer (where I ended up third), I was given a tour of Tempe's R&D facility by Chris Cocalis, the man who has been designing and engineering bikes and parts for decades for a few brands.

Pivot Vault on Competitive Cyclist: https://alnk.to/9bqYGk9

0:00 intro
1:23 men's pro race
2:58 BWR AZ overview
6:01 Pivot Vault
13:31 Maxxis Ramblers
14:42 Pivot facility and R&D tour     

Photo courtesy Kris Hull and Belgian Waffle Ride. (That's the face you make when you take the turn off to do the Wafer instead of the full Waffle.) Thanks, Kris!

--

The Ride is supported in 2023 by 
Castelli clothing: https://www.castelli-cycling.com
Giro helmets: https://www.giro.com
Feedback Sports stands & tools: https://www.feedbacksports.com
